metadata.title: CVE-2023-28856 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Redis is an open source, in-memory database that persists on disk.Authenticated users can use the `HINCRBYFLOAT` command to create an invalidhash field that will crash Redis on access in affected versions. This issuehas been addressed in in versions 7.0.11, 6.2.12, and 6.0.19. Users areadvised to upgrade. There are no known workarounds for this issue.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-28856` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

redis - 5:5.0.7-2ubuntu0.1+esm2
redis-sentinel - 5:5.0.7-2ubuntu0.1+esm2
redis-server - 5:5.0.7-2ubuntu0.1+esm2
redis-tools - 5:5.0.7-2ubuntu0.1+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: redis package in esm-apps/focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5:5.0.7-2ubuntu0.1+esm2').
